item.title: Large sunken area in road., 3rd February
item.description:
Under bridge before marker 84.7 travelling north there is a large hole appearing. It is more of a hole beneath the road than a 'pot hole' in the surface. It is in the right side of lane 1. I will have a qashqai with a high ride height and it felt very large and you actually drive through it rather than bump through it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Council red barriers, 3rd February
item.description:
Hi these barriers have been left outside my house for several weeks now leaning on my fence. I am not sure what they are for or what is happening as they have been there for several weeks. Please can I have an update as to what they are for?

item.title: Pothole at the side of the road, 3rd February
item.description:
Travelling from Staverton/airport traffic lights towards Churchdown. Just after AGD systems perimeter is a pothole in the LH side of the carriageway, in line with the Churchdown "please drive carefully" sign.

item.title: Road needs surfacing, 3rd February
item.description:
Multiple pot holes (the whole rd from train station to the kings arms) which are filled and then come back again and again. Noise from Lorrieâ€™s going over the potholes and uneven road is absolutely awful, cars moving around road to avoid potholes. Building works happening on road causing heavy vehicles to have visited.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 137, Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Pothole in outside lane of dual carriageway, 3rd February
item.description:
There's a pothole in the outside lane of the A417 just after Zoons Court roundabout, going from Brockworth end towards Barnwood. It was previously repaired, but this old repair has failed. It has been there since before Christmas.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury

item.title: Hedge overhanging Charlton Court Road, Cheltenham, 2nd February
item.description:
Hedge cutting took place recently on the mid part of the road by a council worker, who explained to me that it was not possible for him, to cut back the higher branches that interfere with the progress of higher sided vehicles because that role is reserved for the County Council ! Larger vehicles have to pull out, even towards the bends in the road and by parked vehicles. For years the Council's road sweeping vehicle has been unable to clean the gutter under the hedge because of the overhanging hedge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Charlton Court Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Tree causing damage/obstruction to pavement or road
